question_sentence: The prime minister of which country joined tens of thousands of women and nonbinary people in a one-day strike this week?
evidence: Prime Minister Katrin Jakobsdóttir called on female members of her cabinet to join in Tuesday’s strike – "kvennaverkfall" in Icelandic – to push for an end to unequal pay and gender-based violence. Find out more with The Week Unwrapped podcast.

question_sentence: A 14-year-old won the title of America's Top Young Scientist for developing a soap that treats what?
evidence: Teenager Heman Bekele, from Annandale, Virginia, developed a compound-based soap that treats melanoma, the most common cancer in the US. His Skin Cancer Treating Soap (SCTS), which costs only 50 cents to make per bar, earned him a prize of $25,000.

question_sentence: Which country this week announced the sale of military equipment to Armenia amid escalating tensions in the Caucasus?
evidence: The agreement to sell military equipment such as air defence systems to Armenia was announced amid growing fears of a possible invasion by Azerbaijan.The neighbouring Caucasus nation's recent seizure of the semi-autonomous Nagorno-Karabakh enclave "accelerated” the willingness of France – which is home to Europe's largest Armenian community – to “deepen military ties” with Armenia, said Politico.

question_sentence: Formula 1 ace Max Verstappen's victory in the US Grand Prix last Sunday brought his total tally of wins this season to what?
evidence: The Dutch driver had to "work through the field" after starting sixth, said The Associated Press, but "held off the charging Mercedes of Lewis Hamilton" during the final laps in the “Texas heat” to win his third consecutive Grand Prix victory.

question_sentence: Which Indian Hindu festival concluded this week?
evidence: The festival celebrates the victory of the goddess Durga over the demon king Mahishasura, and festivities can last up to 10 days. The celebrations in Kolkata, which this year concluded on Tuesday, have earned the city a spot on Unesco's cultural heritage list, “thanks to their grandeur and historical significance", said Indian broadcaster CNBC TV 18.

question_sentence: A Spanish duke and his wife have triggered controversy by naming their recently christened daughter what?
choices: Zara Bershka Oysho Bimba y Lola Manolo Blahnik Balenciaga Mango
Blanco Amarillo Anaranjado Verde Azul Morado
evidence: Fernando Juan Fitz-James Stuart y de Solís, the 17th Duke of Huéscar and his wife, Sofía Palazuelo, have been told that their daughter’s name will need to be shortened in order to be accepted by Spain's Civil Registry. For more stories from the stranger side of life, sign up to the Tall Tales newsletter.

question_sentence: Which foreign leader told their party "I, too, am human" after taking a day off?
evidence: Italy's prime minister marked her first anniversary in power by taking a "personal day", after splitting from her scandal-hit partner, television presenter Andrea Giambruno. Speaking via video link to a conference held by her Brothers in Italy party on Sunday – two days after she announced the break-up – Meloni said she was "sorry to not be with you in person”.

question_sentence: Who has been named the UK's most influential black person by the Powerlist 2024?
evidence: The Ghanaian-born former stylist became the first black editor-in-chief of British Vogue in 2017, but announced earlier this year that he was stepping down. Doctor Who star Ncuti Gatwa, actor Sir Lenny Henry, football pundit Alex Scott and "The Diary of a CEO" podcaster Steven Bartlett are also on Powerful Media's 2024 list celebrating people of African, African Caribbean and African American heritage.

question_sentence: The Financial Conduct Authority announced this week that the UK cap on bankers' bonuses will be lifted when?
evidence: Financial regulators have confirmed that the controversial limit, introduced by the EU in the wake of the 2008 financial crisis, will be lifted from 31 October – almost a year after then chancellor Kwasi Kwarteng announced that the cap would be scrapped.

question_sentence: Who is the new speaker of the US House of Representatives?
evidence: Following three weeks of infighting, the Republican-led House finally elected the little-known Louisiana congressman on Wednesday as the 56th speaker, replacing ousted California Republican Kevin McCarthy. Johnson, a close ally of Donald Trump, has acknowledged the challenges of his new office, stressing the need to "unify our membership and build consensus" across the GOP.

question_sentence: Hundreds of officers this week were called to respond to two mass shootings in which state?
evidence: A shooting rampage took place Wednesday at a restaurant and a bowling alley in Lewiston, Maine. The violence added to a list of 565 mass shootings reported across the US this year, according to the Gun Violence Archive.

question_sentence: Which Republican was elected as the new House speaker on Wednesday?
evidence: After weeks of party infighting, Louisiana Rep. Mike Johnson secured the speaker’s gavel without losing any Republican votes.

question_sentence: Around what percentage of Americans get their flu shot each year?
evidence: The CDC recommends that everyone age 6 months and older get a seasonal flu vaccine each year, but fewer than half of Americans get vaccinated.

question_sentence: An off-duty Alaska Airlines pilot has been accused of trying to shut off a plane’s engines mid-flight. Which drug did he say he had consumed before the incident?
evidence: The pilot accused of attempting to disable a plane’s engines mid-flight told investigators he believed he was dreaming and had taken “magic mushrooms” about 48 hours before the incident, according to court documents. He has been charged with 83 felony counts of attempted murder.

question_sentence: Which cryptocurrency saw a 20% jump over the past week?
evidence: Bitcoin is surging again, topping $35,000 for the first time since May 2022. It’s up 20% over the past week.

question_sentence: What is the name of the hurricane that slammed into Acapulco, Mexico, this week?
evidence: Hurricane Otis dealt a devastating blow to Mexico’s coast after making landfall as a record-breaking Category 5 storm.

question_sentence: Which company was sued by dozens of states this week for allegedly harming young users’ mental health?
evidence: Dozens of states sued Instagram-parent Meta on Tuesday, alleging that its designs — such as infinite news feeds and frequent notifications — have contributed to a mental health crisis in the US.

question_sentence: Roughly how many student loan borrowers recently received inaccurate bills?
evidence: The Department of Education announced about 300,000 student loan borrowers recently got monthly bills with the wrong amount — many with charges higher than they should be.

question_sentence: Which automaker reached a tentative agreement with unionized workers to end a bruising strike?
evidence: More than 16,000 autoworkers are set to return to their jobs after the United Auto Workers union and Ford reached a tentative deal to end a strike.

question_sentence: Which popular series is getting a reality show spinoff?
evidence: A reality competition show based on the wildly popular series “Squid Game” will stream on Netflix next month. According to an official synopsis, the series follows 456 contestants who “enter the competition show in pursuit of a life-changing reward of USD $4.56 million.”

question_sentence: Who is the only American finalist for the Varkey Foundation Global Teacher Prize 2023?
Why did comedian Nikki Glaser spend $25,000 on Taylor Swift concert tickets this year?
choices: She wanted to break a record for attending the most concerts.
She was on tour with Taylor Swift.
She bought the tickets for her children.

question_sentence: What happened to the three Dover High School football players in the car crash near Felton?
choices: They were uninjured in the crash.
They were charged with criminally negligent homicide.
They were critically injured in the crash.

question_sentence: What is the primary claim made by the attorney general in the lawsuit against Meta Platforms Inc.?
choices: Meta knowingly collected data from users without parental consent.
Meta concealed the extent of the psychological and health harms suffered by young users.
Meta violated state consumer protection laws.

question_sentence: What is included in Iron Hill Brewery & Restaurant's Witches Brew Flight, available from October 27th to October 29th?
What is the purpose of the $750 million in federal funding awarded to Delaware, Pennsylvania, and New Jersey for the Mid-Atlantic Hydrogen Hub?
choices: To fund research and development of residential hydrogen power.
To reduce carbon emissions in residential heating.
To create hydrogen power plants for residential electricity.

question_sentence: What was the fate of Wawa's plan for a drive-thru-only store in Newark?
choices: The plan was approved, and construction has begun.
The plan is currently under review by the City Council.
The plan was relocated to a different area in Newark.

question_sentence: What was one of the key issues mentioned in the lawsuit against Regal Builders LLC?
choices: Lack of resident participation in governing boards

question_sentence: Why do ladybugs often enter houses during the fall and winter seasons?
choices: To look for a place to lay their eggs

question_sentence: What is the opening time for the new Helen's Sausage House location in Newark?
choices: 4 a.m. to noon Monday through Saturday
